Class Expression

    • Constructor Detail

      • Expression

        public Expression(java.lang.String expression)
        Constructs a Tree representing the given arithmetic expression, then verifies that the newly created Tree is valid as an expression. If the Tree is invalid, throws an IllegalArgumentException.
        Here are the validity rules:
        • The value of each node must be one of "+", "-", "*", "/", or a String representing an unsigned integer.
        • If a node has value "+" or "*", it must have two or more children.
        • If a node has value "-" or "/", it must have exactly two children.
        • If a node contains a numeric string, it must be a leaf.
        Note that the input parameter uses prefix notation, for example: "+ (5 10 -( *(15 20) 25) 30)"
        Parameters:
        expression - The String representation of the expression to be constructed.

    • Method Detail
